abstracts.cdata!:
The Bicol Power Restoration Project
            demonstrates how the World Bank, government, and
            implementing agency can work together in responding to and
            recovering from natural calamities. Through the project, 5
            million residents in 3,359 barangays or villages (out of
            3,410) in the Bicol Region of the Philippines now have a
            stable power supply that is resilient against typhoons
            frequently affecting the region.
